newsitem.title: USA: Clinton postpones Latin America trip.
newsitem.headline: Clinton postpones Latin America trip.

text.p: President Bill Clinton said on Tuesday he had decided to postpone a trip to Latin America scheduled for May until later in the year because of his injured knee.

Speaking at a White House event on health care, Clinton said he would visit Mexico, Barbados and Costa Rica in May. He had been due to visit Mexico April 11-12, but the Mexican foreign ministry said Tuesday this had been moved to May 6-7.

Clinton's visits to Barbados and Costa Rica, originally scheduled for the extended Latin America trip in May, would be combined with the Mexico trip and take place May 6-10, the White House said in a statement released after Clinton spoke.
Clinton, who tore a tendon in his right knee on March 14, will visit Brazil, Argentina and Venezuela Oct. 12-17, the statement added. The Latin America trip had been scheduled for May 6-13.
"Later in the year, we're going to go to South America and do that trip when I'm somewhat more mobile," added Clinton, who is on crutches as he recovers from knee surgery.

"Among other things we're going to Argentina and Brazil, they're big countries, there's going to be a lot of moving around and I need a little more physical mobility," he said. "Besides, I'm hoping to ride horses and do some other things and I'm not quite ready for that as you can see."
